location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The correspondence in the file is arranged in a rough chronological order, from the earliest piece at the front of the file, to the latest at the end.

Foliation: The file is foliated from the front cover to the last page of correspondence, with a pencil number in the top-right corner of each recto. The inside back cover is unfoliated.Condition: Close-cropping of pages during a earlier binding/preservation, has resulted in some words at the edges of the page being truncated. There is also evidence of insect damage on some pages. Neither of these issues affect the legibility or understanding of items in the file.

mods.abstract: Correspondence between the Resident in the Persian Gulf (Major, then Lieutenant-Colonel, Samuel Hennell), his native Agents at Muscat and Sharjah, and the Government of Bombay. The correspondence in the file reports on the hostilities taking place between the Governor of Muscat, Thuwaini bin Said, and the Chief of Suhar, Said Hamood bin Azan, and the Bombay and India Governments' responses to the crisis.

name.namePart: Syf bin Hamūd Āl Bū Sa‘īd
Emir of Abu Dhabi, Āl Nahyān dynasty
